snippet: State lawmakers, prompted by violence in New York City and two recent mass shootings, are seeking to tighten legislation that is already among the country’s strictest.
abstract: New York State lawmakers are planning a push to win approval of tighter state gun laws, prompted by recent violence in New York City and in the wake of mass shootings in Colorado and Wisconsin; one measure would require background checks for the purchase ammunition, while another would limit the purchase of firearms to one per person per month.

byline.contributor: Wendy Ruderman and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: State lawmakers, prompted by violence in New York City and two recent mass shootings, are seeking to tighten legislation that is already among the country’s strictest.
